title: Number Patterns
description: Can you figure out what comes next? Test your pattern recognition with these number sequences!

questions.question: What comes next in the pattern? 2, 4, 6, 8, ___
questions.explanation: Each number increases by 2. So after 8, the next number is 10.

questions.question: What comes next? 3, 6, 12, 24, ___
questions.explanation: Each number is doubled (multiplied by 2). So 24 × 2 = 48.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, ___
questions.explanation: This is the Fibonacci sequence — each number is the sum of the two before it. 5 + 8 = 13.

questions.question: What comes next? 100, 90, 80, 70, ___
questions.explanation: Each number decreases by 10. So after 70, the next number is 60.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, ___
questions.explanation: These are perfect squares: 1², 2², 3², 4², 5². The next is 6² = 36.

questions.question: What comes next? 2, 5, 10, 17, 26, ___
questions.explanation: The differences increase by 2 each time: +3, +5, +7, +9, +11. So 26 + 11 = 37.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 3, 7, 15, 31, ___
questions.explanation: Each number is double the previous number plus 1. So 31 × 2 + 1 = 63. (Also: 2ⁿ − 1 pattern.)

questions.question: What comes next? 5, 10, 20, 40, 80, ___
questions.explanation: Each number is doubled. So 80 × 2 = 160.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 2, 4, 7, 11, 16, ___
questions.explanation: The differences increase by 1 each time: +1, +2, +3, +4, +5, +6. So 16 + 6 = 22.

questions.question: What comes next? 3, 9, 27, 81, ___
questions.explanation: Each number is multiplied by 3. These are powers of 3: 3¹, 3², 3³, 3⁴. Next is 3⁵ = 243.

questions.question: What comes next? 0, 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, ___
questions.explanation: These are triangular numbers. The differences increase by 1: +1, +2, +3, +4, +5, +6. So 15 + 6 = 21.

questions.question: What comes next? 2, 6, 18, 54, ___
questions.explanation: Each number is multiplied by 3. So 54 × 3 = 162.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 8, 27, 64, ___
questions.explanation: These are perfect cubes: 1³, 2³, 3³, 4³. The next is 5³ = 125.

questions.question: What comes next? 50, 45, 40, 35, 30, ___
questions.explanation: Each number decreases by 5. So after 30, the next number is 25.

questions.question: What comes next? 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, ___
questions.explanation: These are prime numbers (divisible only by 1 and themselves). The next prime after 13 is 17.

questions.question: What comes next? 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, ___
questions.explanation: Each number is doubled. So 64 × 2 = 128. These are powers of 2 starting from 2².

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 4, 2, 5, 3, 6, ___
questions.explanation: Two interleaved sequences: 1, 2, 3, 4... and 4, 5, 6, 7... The next number in the first sequence is 4.

questions.question: What comes next? 10, 11, 13, 16, 20, ___
questions.explanation: The differences increase by 1: +1, +2, +3, +4, +5. So 20 + 5 = 25.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 2, 6, 24, 120, ___
questions.explanation: These are factorials: 1!, 2!, 3!, 4!, 5!. The next is 6! = 720.

questions.question: What comes next? 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, 21, 28, ___
questions.explanation: These are triangular numbers. The differences increase by 1: +2, +3, +4, +5, +6, +7, +8. So 28 + 8 = 36.
